aircraft.value: Medusa Strike - AC-1997-524 at Zone-1 Facility

defect_observed.value: Weapon release circuit malfunction. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.

root_cause.value: Design limitation in component load capacity under extreme conditions

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Ammunition Feed component. Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.

corrective_action.value: Implement enhanced testing protocol before component installation

preventive_action.value: Modify design to incorporate additional safety margin

remarks_investigation.value: Investigation completed as per established procedures. All findings documented.

remarks_design.value: Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol. Date: 08/10/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Manufacturing quality documentation reviewed. No deviations noted. Concur with investigation findings. Date: 11/10/2024 Signature: Dr. A.K. Sharma

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions. Date: 11/10/2024 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Quality assurance framework assessed. Investigation process followed established protocols. Findings are valid. Date: 11/10/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) Airworthiness implications assessed. Recommend issuance of technical directive for fleet-wide compliance. Date: 16/10/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar

Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Major
b) Defect Observed: Weapon release circuit malfunction. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Design limitation in component load capacity under extreme conditions
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Ammunition Feed component. Functional
testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Implement enhanced testing protocol before component installation
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Modify design to incorporate additional safety margin
d) Attributable Code: R - Lapses on the part of Repair Agency/Manufacturer
